fb8899db-3ae0-4111-9daa-4191b0378450.description: You are now capable of grasping the distinctness of each Gospel. You have an understanding of the way each was written, the community behind it, and the particular questions it is responding to. You can open up its relevance for today, and bring it alive for students. You can make connections across to other curriculum areas such as literature, narrative, history and ethics. You have a deeper appreciation of the actions, teachings and mission of Jesus, and how these are reflected in communities.
fb8899db-3ae0-4111-9daa-4191b0378450.name: Cornerstones - Understanding the Gospels

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching Accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in fortnightly sessions over 8 weeks (4 sessions in total). The duration of each session is 2 hours. The first hour is instructor led, the second hour is group participation.
Complete four by 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

1b861a27-8236-4a00-a1d0-f5db2c85972f.description: With this unit completed you will be able to relate the sacraments to the love and graciousness of God, set them within the context of God’s ongoing presence to creation, and know and teach key points in the history of Baptism, Confirmation, Eucharist and Reconciliation. You will be equipped to teach the foundations of sacraments to students, explain the rites of each sacrament, meet your curriculum goals, and respond to some of the more difficult questions students, parents and colleagues ask.
1b861a27-8236-4a00-a1d0-f5db2c85972f.name: Cornerstones - Introduction to Sacraments

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: Teaching accreditation 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in fortnightly sessions over 8 weeks (4 sessions in total). The duration of each session is 2 hours. The first hour is instructor led, the second hour is group participation.
Complete four by 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

a4da5325-f98d-424c-8017-b166e8f56cc9.description: From this unit you will be able to articulate what worship and liturgy are, and their place in the life of faith. With this you will gain a clear understanding of the centrality of scripture for all forms of worship, and the various ways it is taken into Catholic rituals. You will be able to explain key aspects of the liturgical year and the physical and bodily nature of worship, as well as the importance of attending to the language we use.
a4da5325-f98d-424c-8017-b166e8f56cc9.name: Cornerstones - Introduction to Worship

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in fortnightly sessions over 8 weeks (4 sessions in total). The duration of each session is 2 hours. The first hour is instructor led, the second hour is group participation.
Complete four by 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

0cbc99cc-a64d-49e0-bbab-c9396b9dc9fd.description: On completion of this unit you are able to articulate the Jewish approach to scripture in the time of Jesus, and how it relates to Dei Verbum. You will be able to speak to the way the culture in ancient Israel gave expression to the revelation of God to the people as they journeyed together across history. You can identify the spirituality of key Jewish collections of books, the Torah, the Prophets and the Wisdom literature, and apply these to contemporary situations.
0cbc99cc-a64d-49e0-bbab-c9396b9dc9fd.name: Cornerstones - Introduction to the Old Testament

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in three online sessions of 2 hours each. Participants engage in online lectures, readings, online resources, guided group discussions, and reflection activities, applying the material to their personal and professional development.
Complete four assessments consisting of Discussion posts and essays.

ce272d02-e0cd-4230-8195-7c75faa12194.description: Through this unit the participant is able to articulate the role of prayer in the Catholic school. They can lead and teach traditional catholic forms of prayer, including the Lord’s Prayer, Grace before and after meals, the Hail Mary, the Rosary and the Examen. They can apply blessing prayers, petitions, meditation, contemplation and praying with art and Icons to the classroom setting.
ce272d02-e0cd-4230-8195-7c75faa12194.name: Cornerstones - Catholic Forms of Prayer

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in fortnightly sessions over 8 weeks (4 sessions in total). The duration of each session is 2 hours. The first hour is instructor led, the second hour is group participation.
Complete four by 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

92c29e60-d264-408f-a934-8a5f53e54a8e.description: This unit articulates what scripture means to Catholics. In understanding different ways to interpret the Bible, participants can explain why interpretation is essential in the Catholic reading of the sacred texts and why contemporary Catholics are not fundamentalists. In recognizing the many ways that the scriptures are alive in our culture today , participants can successfully integrate this in teaching Religious Education.
92c29e60-d264-408f-a934-8a5f53e54a8e.name: Cornerstones - How Catholics Approach Scripture

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in fortnightly sessions over 8 weeks (4 sessions in total). The duration of each session is 2 hours. The first hour is instructor led, the second hour is group participation.
Complete four by 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

77394386-b114-49cd-b968-1e6541f667c6.description: This unit explores the New Testament. Participants can explain Jesus from within his historical and cultural context, and relate the Gospels and letters to the person and mission of Jesus. They can articulate a spirituality of Jesus. They are able to consider biblical texts, articulate them as encounters with God, and use them for meditating on the scripture and teaching in the classroom.
77394386-b114-49cd-b968-1e6541f667c6.name: Cornerstones - Introduction to the New Testament

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in fortnightly sessions over 8 weeks (4 sessions in total). The duration of each session is 2 hours. The first hour is instructor led, the second hour is group participation.
Complete four by 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

3bf90380-f097-4b3d-8db2-1841cc33acaf.description: Understanding the biblical foundations of Catholic Social Justice Teachings, participants can explain the concepts of human dignity, the common good and the preferential option for the poor. They can apply subsidiarity and participation, stewardship of creation and our global solidarity to the Catholic School. Participants can evaluate how social justice teachings are relevant in our culture today, and integrate these into the classroom, curriculum, the Catholic School and spiritual development.
3bf90380-f097-4b3d-8db2-1841cc33acaf.name: Cornerstones - Catholic Social Teaching

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in fortnightly sessions over 8 weeks (4 sessions in total). The duration of each session is 2 hours. The first hour is instructor led, the second hour is group participation.
Complete four by 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

af3a2c9e-76f7-4543-b620-c495f0314876.description: In this unit you will examine aspects of the Catholic understanding of the relationship between faith and science. We will focus on some texts of Scripture from the First and Second Testaments.
af3a2c9e-76f7-4543-b620-c495f0314876.name: Science and the Bible

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in 2 sessions over 2 weeks. The duration of the session is 1.5 hours.
Complete a 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

skills.name: Using The Bible In The Classroom

c0a3f577-f9a7-4706-a7c9-7ffeff7fa922.description: From this unit you will be able to articulate the key structures of the Mass and their place in the life of faith. You will know who are the appropriate ministers of each of the rites. You will gain a clear understanding of the centrality of scripture in the Mass. You will be able to prepare the liturgy, and explain its parts and rationale to others. You will have an understanding of the use of the body and language in the Mass, and have at hand some tools for evaluating the service.
c0a3f577-f9a7-4706-a7c9-7ffeff7fa922.name: The Mass in Three Hours

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

badge_template_activities.title: Each learner participates in two online zoom sessions of 1.5 hours each, set at one week apart. The sessions are led by a specialist in the field, and cover the structure, history and practical planning issues around the celebration of the Mass. Time is dedicated to group reflection and questions, and questions and queries are followed up by group and individual email responses from the presenter.

Participants write a 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions. The response includes a summary of the content, the impact of the material personally, and the possible ways of implementing the content into the workplace.

fcf25e3d-10d1-4eb7-a06c-2aea78f6e136.description: From this unit you will be able to describe the essence of prayer and its role in the life of faith. You will understand more deeply the background to the great prayers of the Christian tradition. You will be able to lead others in spontaneous vocal prayer and you will gain the skills for facilitating the following forms of meditative prayer: lectio divina, praying with art, praying with icons, the examen, and Christian meditation.
fcf25e3d-10d1-4eb7-a06c-2aea78f6e136.name: Prayer

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in 2 sessions over 2 weeks. The duration of the session is 1.5 hours.
Complete a 500 word online post in response to the content and discussions.

2938fbf6-a49e-4faa-8959-ab836620cc28.description: On completion of this unit you are able to articulate how scripture is an inspired form of Christian revelation as understood in the Vatican II document Dei Verbum. You will recognize that the biblical texts are presented in a variety of literary forms. You can apply the 'Worlds of the Text' approach as you analyse texts. You can explore genre as a guide to biblical meaning. With this, you are aware of the shortcomings of literalist and fundamentalist readings of the bible. However you can
2938fbf6-a49e-4faa-8959-ab836620cc28.name: THEO891 - Catholic Approach to Scripture in Vatican II

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

entity.name: BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

alignments.name: Teaching accreditation
alignments.description: 20 hours of Accreditation to Teach Religious Education. The course is created to meet the criteria of the Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in three online sessions of 2 hours each. Participants engage in online lectures, readings, online resources, guided group discussions, and reflection activities, applying the material to their personal and professional development.
Complete four assessments consisting of Discussion posts and essays.

bb649274-2281-413a-81dd-c80e85a88952.description: On completion of this unit you are able to articulate the cultural context of Jesus and his disciples. You can relate the Gospels to the development of the Jesus' movement and the writing of the New Testament letters. You can identify and apply the foundational characteristics of a spirituality based in Jesus life and mission, and apply these to contemporary situations.
bb649274-2281-413a-81dd-c80e85a88952.name: THEO891 - Introduction to the New Testament

issuer.summary: issued by BBI - The Australian Institute of Theological Education

9bb353e6-351b-4c3d-ba81-55bbdb031e1c.description: On completion of this unit you are able to articulate the Jewish approach to scripture in the time of Jesus, and how it relates to Dei Verbum. You will be able to speak to the way the culture in ancient Israel gave expression to the revelation of God to the people as they journeyed together across history. You can identify the spirituality of key Jewish collections of books, the Torah, the Prophets and the Wisdom literature, and apply these to contemporary situations.
9bb353e6-351b-4c3d-ba81-55bbdb031e1c.name: THEO891 - Introduction to the Old Testament

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in three online sessions of 2 hours each. Participants engage in online lectures, readings, online resources, guided group discussions, and reflection activities, applying the material to their personal and professional development.
Complete four assessments consisting of Discussion posts and essays.

9058d8bf-99ad-4d57-bc39-3595d06be7c4.description: On completion of this unit you are able to articulate the characteristics of Jesus in each of the four Gospels. You can relate the Gospels to the development of the Jesus' movement. You can identify and apply the foundational characteristics of a spirituality based in Jesus' life, relationships and mission, and apply these to contemporary situations.
9058d8bf-99ad-4d57-bc39-3595d06be7c4.name: THEO891 - The Gospels
